moves.5. Ng5: But that move would not be wise to copy
moves.5... d5 6. exd5: black lost a pawn but it prevented white from doing nx7 forking d8 and h8
moves.6... Ng4: He tried to do the same
moves.7. Nge4 Nxf2 8. Nxf2 Bxf2+ 9. Kxf2 Qh4+: Black can now gain the bishop on c4
moves.25. Bxc7: White tries to turn it into a trade, hoping black doesn't realize c6 is trapped
moves.26. Rxe6: So c6 takes whatever it can before dying
moves.26... Re7xe6 27. Bf4 g5 28. Bd2: D2 and C1 were the only safe squares
Black really loves moving that rook doesn't he?
moves.37. a4 f4 38. gxf4 gxf4 39. Rxf4 Rxf4 40:
White did that with no hesitation
Not sure why
moves.52... Rf8 53. Ke5 Rf7 54. Kf5 Rf8: Black saw his opportunity to have a 3 fold repetition and draw since he was down in material
moves.55. Ke5:
Since it was a draw the teachers decided who won by looking at the past tourney games checking the statistics. Turns out black did better in this tourney and he won. Yay!
Thanks for viewing
